newsitem.title: GERMANY: EU beef intervention stocks put at 480,000 T.
newsitem.headline: EU beef intervention stocks put at 480,000 T.

text.p: European Union beef intervention stocks at the end of February totalled 480,000 tonnes compared with 8,000 tonnes a year earlier, the German agriculture ministry said in a weekly circular.
EU beef consumption has plummeted since the mad cow disease crisis erupted a year ago and the EU buying into public stocks was aimed at supporting producers.
The Bonn ministry report said total purchases since the crisis totalled 488,000 tonnes, of which 137,000 tonnes were German beef.
The British government said a year ago it could not be ruled out a fatal cattle disease, bovine spongiform encephalopathy, could be transmitted to humans.
